briefdescription.para: Initializes the billing services module with the given settings. This call is optional and only need to be called if you have custom settings to initialize this feature.

parameterdescription.para: The settings to be used for initialization.

detaileddescription.para: The settings configure the default image to be used for products.

briefdescription.para: Returns the cached products array retrieved from store.

simplesect.para: This property is invalid until a call to InitializeStore is completed.

briefdescription.para: Event that will be called when registered billing products are retreived from the Store.
Event that will be called when payment state changes.
Event that will be called when restored transaction details are received from the Store.
Event that will be called when an external product purchase action is performed - For ex: from AppStore page.

simplesect.para: If auto show external product purchase request is enabled, you don't need to do anything in this event callback. Else you need to call BuyProduct from the event callback.
Check https://developer.apple.com/documentation/storekit/testing-promoted-in-app-purchases for more details on how to test external product purchase actions.

briefdescription.para: Sends a request to retrieve localized information about the billing products from the Store.

detaileddescription.para: Call to this method retrieves information of the products that are configured in Billing Settings. Your application uses this request to present localized prices and other information to the user without having to maintain that list itself.

simplesect.para: When the request completes, OnInitializeStoreComplete is fired.

briefdescription.para: Sends a request to retrieve localized information about the billing products from the Store.

detaileddescription.para: Call to this method retrieves information of the products that are configured in Billing Settings. Your application uses this request to present localized prices and other information to the user without having to maintain that list itself.

simplesect.para: When the request completes, OnInitializeStoreComplete is fired.

briefdescription.para: Gets the billing product with localized information, which was previously fetched from the Store.

simplesect.para: The billing product fetched with localized information.

parameterdescription.para: A string used to identify a billing product.
Whether inactive products should be considered in search. Default is false.

briefdescription.para: Determines whether the user is authorised to make payments.

simplesect.para: true if the user is allowed to make product purchase payment; otherwise, false.

briefdescription.para: Determines whether specified billing product is already purchased.

simplesect.para: true if specified billing product is already purchased; otherwise, false.

parameterdescription.para: The identifier of the billing product.

simplesect.para: This works only for Non-Consumable (Managed) billing product. For Consumable products, this will always returns false.

briefdescription.para: Determines whether specified billing product is already purchased.

simplesect.para: true if specified billing product is already purchased; otherwise, false.

parameterdescription.para: The object identifies the billing product registered in the Store.

simplesect.para: This works only for Non-Consumable (Managed) billing product. For Consumable products, this will always returns false.

briefdescription.para: Initiates purchase process for the specified billing product.

parameterdescription.para: The product you want to purchase.

briefdescription.para: Initiates purchase process for the specified billing product.

simplesect.para: The payment request must have a product identifier registered with the Store.

parameterdescription.para: The product you want to purchase.
Create BuyProductOptions object to set custom quantity and purchase tag.

briefdescription.para: Returns the pending transactions available in transaction queue.

simplesect.para: User needs to manually call this method after receiving completed transactions, incase if autoFinishTransactions flag is turned off in billing settings.

briefdescription.para: Completes the pending transactions and removes it from transaction queue.
Sends a request to restore completed purchases.

detaileddescription.para: Your application calls this method to restore transactions that were previously purchased so that you can process them again.

simplesect.para: Internally this feature requires non-consumable product information. So ensure that InitializeStore is called prior to this.

parameterdescription.para: If set to true force refresh by contacting server. On iOS this will trigger a login prompt to let user signin. So set this to true only if user clicks manually "Restore" option in IAP screens.

This can be a unique identifier which was passed in BuyProductOptions when purchasing a product. Usually, this can be the application username or any unique identifier for which you want to restore purchases for. (optional)

briefdescription.para: Provides cross-platform interface to request payment from a user for additional functionality or content that your application delivers.

detaileddescription.para: This feature connects to the Store on your apps behalf to securely process payments from users, prompting them to authorize payment. The feature then notifies your app, which provides the purchased items to users. For processing requests, feature contacts App Store, Google Play Store on iOS, Android platform respectively. You need to configure iOS billing product details at iTunes Connect. Similarly for Android, you can set these details at Google Play Developer Console.

The interaction between the user, your app, and the Store during the purchase process take place in three stages. First, the your app displays purchasable products received from the Store. Second, the user selects a product to buy and the app requests payment from the Store. Third, the Store processes the payment and your app delivers the purchased product.

Optionally, you can choose to verify receipts of completed transactions. The receipt is a record of purchase made from within the application and enabling receipt validation, adds one more level security to avoid unauthorised purchases.

Users can also restore products that were previously purchased. As per iOS guidelines, if your application supports product types that are restorable, you must include an interface that allows users to restore these purchases.
